message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.CL

This paper deals with the specification and construction of syntax and operational semantics of a programming language, which falls under the category of formal languages and automata theory. The paper specifically focuses on languages with variable binding, such as the pure lambda calculus, which is a topic of interest in logic and computation (cs.LO). The paper also discusses the use of algebraic signatures and equations to specify syntax, which is a topic in programming languages (cs.PL) and software engineering (cs.SE). The paper further explores the operational semantics of a programming language, which is a topic in formal languages (cs.FL) and computational logic (cs.CL).
